newsitem.title: USA: Farm Family sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Farm Family sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Farm Family Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it adopted a shareholder rights plan with a 20 percent trigger.
The company said in a news release that it adopted the plan to ensure that its shareholders receive fair treatment in the event of a proposed takeover.
Under the plan, the company will distribute a dividend of one Preferred Share Purchase Right for each outstanding share of Farm Family Holdings' common stock.
The record date for the rights distribution is July 29, and the rights will expire 10 years later unless redeemed earlier by the company.
Farm Family in its news release did not say if it was aware of any specific takeover attempt, and company officials could not immediately be reached for comment.
Farm Family Holdings is the parent of Farm Family Casualty Insurance Co.
